text: so let's move on now down to some conversations about the markets quickly what are the markets in short the markets are built of exchanges things like the nicey the new york stock exchange which you likely have heard before places like that and they provide access to securities there are different kinds of securities there's a couple major buckets we have equities debt derivatives technically there's another one over here called hybrids which we're not going to get into because it doesn't matter for the conversation right now but for equities think stocks individual stocks and companies you've heard that before that is what equities are there's also etfs that can be considered in there things like that debt is bonds cds things of that nature it's essentially something where money was loaned and it's going to get paid back with interest and then derivatives this is what i do i've talked to you about this before which is derivatives being options and futures so these are contracts that their value is derived from something else so we'll get into a little bit more about some general market concepts down here but it's really important to note that the markets are large there are a ton of players in it and we make up retail traders make up a small part of that okay we need a brokerage account essentially this is the middleman you need them as you know tim or john or eric i directly cannot access
